title: What is an element with 7 protons, 7 neutrons, and 10 electrons? - Quora

response.answer_text: You don’t need to know the number of neutrons and electrons of an atom when identifying what element it is ! Because every element is specialized by the number of protons. Every element can be similar to each other at some features but the number of protons can’t; for example, all Nitrogen atoms have 7 protons in theirs nuclei and contrarily, any atom having 7 protons is Nitrogen ! So, in one day, if that Nitrogen atom has less or more protons, it won’t be Nitrogen anymore ! :D Also, that’s the way to form Periodic Table ! (see more: Periodic table - Wikipedia) Hope you understand ! ;)
